definition: see 聰明一世，糊塗一時|聪明一世，糊涂一时[cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2]
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , meng3 dong3 yi1 shi2

sentences.english: What advice do you have for those of us who are a little bit unclear?
sentences.chinese: 对于那些还懵懵懂懂的人，你们有什么建议吗？

sentences.english: You can't have so much ignorant dreams any more.
sentences.chinese: 你不能再有这么多懵懂的梦想。

sentences.english: You can’t have all these adolescent dreams.
sentences.chinese: 你不能再有这么多懵懂的梦想。

sentences.english: He often lives in a haze of whisky.
sentences.chinese: 他常常是在威士忌的懵懂醉意中度过的。

sentences.english: I think the freshman is more matureer than other cotemporary students.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这小子比懵懂的学生思想成熟。

sentences.english: You should drop so many vague dreams.
sentences.chinese: 你不能再有这么多懵懂的梦想。

sentences.english: Perhaps it was Curcuma were really too young, muddle into their sky.
sentences.chinese: 也许当时莪们年纪真的太小，懵懵懂懂走进各自天空。

sentences.english: But I, being young and foolish, with her would not agree.
sentences.chinese: 但是我，年轻又懵懂，不肯赞同她的话。

sentences.english: "An Umbrella over the Shoulder" records the pains and happiness of love.
sentences.chinese: 《膊头担伞》记载这懵懂爱情的酸涩与甜蜜。

sentences.english: But because of ignorant overflows the sentiment. Because ignorant only then is injured.
sentences.chinese: 因为愚昧而去滥情因为懵懂才去受伤。

sentences.english: When I was just a lad of ten, my father said to me.
sentences.chinese: 我还是个懵懂少年那时，父亲曾对我讲。

sentences.english: Muddleheaded I suddenly reaped a love.
sentences.chinese: 懵懵懂懂，突然收获了一份爱情。

sentences.english: I was still muddled, even after he had explained.
sentences.chinese: 听了他的解释，我还是懵懵懂懂。

definition: first awakening of love (usually of a girl) (idiom)
still possessing the innocence of childhood (idiom)
a girl's teenage years (idiom); maidenhood/a budding beauty
